clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of the Cheetah NICOM by Comparison to TEE During Open Vascular Surgery - Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of the Cheetah NICOM by Comparison to TEE During Open Vascular Surgery - Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The Cheetah NICOM is a non-invasive cardiac output monitor that has been validated in various clinical contexts but not during the occlusion of major arteries, as takes place in vascular surgery. The present study will evaluate the precision and validity of the measures taken by the device during open vascular surgery procedures. The measurements will be compared to the those calculated by transesophageal echocardiography at various key points during the surgeries. The validity of the cardiac output, stroke volume and stroke volume variation measurements will be evaluated, as well as the device's ability to track rapid changes in cardiac output.

primary_outcome.measure: Validity of Stroke Volume (SV) Measurements by the Cheetah NICOM
primary_outcome.description: The SV measured by the Cheetah NICOM will be compared to the one measured by transesophageal echocardiography at multiple time points during the surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroke Volume (SV) with a vascular cross-clamp
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Per vascular surgery procedure when a cross-clamp is installed
secondary_outcome.description: The SV measured by the Cheetah NICOM will be compared to the one measured by transesophageal echocardiography at multiple points once a vascular cross-clamp is installed.
Between each pair of consecutive data points, the change of SV measurements given by the Cheetah NICOM will be compared to those given by transesophageal echocardiography.

arm_group.description: The impact of large abdominal retractors and an abdominal aortic cross-clamp on the validity of the Cheetah NICOM's measurements will be evaluated in this group.
The impact of the clamping of a large peripheral arterial vessel on the validity of the Cheetah NICOM's measurements will be evaluated in this group.

intervention.description: The Cheetah NICOM will be installed on all patients to evaluate the validity of its measurements.
TEE will serve as gold standard measurements for the evaluation of the Cheetah NICOM.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing either an open aortic aneurysm repair surgery or a femoral endarterectomy under general anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient undergoing an elective open aortic aneurysm repair surgery or a femoral endarterectomy under general anesthesia.
- ASA 1-3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refuses general anesthesia
- Contraindication to transesophageal echocardiography
- Allergy to the glue of the Cheetah NICOM probes
- Severe aortic valve regurgitation
- Thoracic aorta anatomy anomaly
- Unipolar pacemaker
